sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Do not initiate if serum calcium levels are below the lower limit of normal.
  • Dialysis procedure - Renal impairment, chronic - Secondary hyperparathyroidism: Initial: 30 mg ORALLY once daily; titrate as necessary no more frequently than every 2 to 4 weeks through sequential doses of 60 mg, 90 mg, 120 mg, and 180 mg ORALLY once daily
  • Hypercalcemia - Parathyroid carcinoma: Initial: 30 mg ORALLY twice daily; titrate as necessary every 2 to 4 weeks through sequential doses of 30 mg twice daily, 60 mg twice daily, 90 mg twice daily, and 90 mg 3 to 4 times daily
  • Primary hyperparathyroidism: Initial: 30 mg ORALLY twice daily; titrate as necessary every 2 to 4 weeks through sequential doses of 30 mg twice daily, 60 mg twice daily, 90 mg twice daily, and 90 mg 3 to 4 times daily

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: Safety and efficacy of cinacalcet hydrochloride use in pediatric patients have not been established.

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Renal impairment: No adjustment necessary
  • Hepatic impairment, moderate to severe: Increased cinacalcet exposure; monitor intact parathyroid hormone, serum calcium, and serum phosphorus closely
  • Hypocalcemia (serum calcium 7.5 to 8.4 mg/dL or hypocalcemia symptoms), secondary hyperparathyroidism in patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis: Raise calcium levels with calcium-based phosphate binders and vitamin D sterols.
  • Hypocalcemia (serum calcium less than 7.5 mg/dL or persistent symptoms and unable to increase vitamin D dose), secondary hyperparathyroidism in patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis: Stop cinacalcet therapy and reinitiate with the next lowest dose when serum calcium reaches 8 mg/dL or symptoms have resolved.

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Dialysis procedure - Renal impairment, chronic - Secondary hyperparathyroidism
  • Hypercalcemia - Parathyroid carcinoma
  • Primary hyperparathyroidism

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- QT interval prolongation and ventricular arrhythmia secondary to hypocalcemia have been reported
  • -- Arrhythmia, hypotension, and worsening of heart failure have been reported in patients with impaired cardiac function
  • Endocrine and Metabolic:
  • -- Hypocalcemia can occur and may result in life-threatening or fatal events; monitoring recommended
  • -- Not indicated for use in patients not undergoing dialysis due to an increased risk of hypocalcemia
  • Hepatic:
  • -- Monitoring recommended in patients with hepatic impairment
  • Musculoskeletal:
  • -- Adynamic bone disease may occur with intact parathyroid hormone (iPTH) levels less than 100 picogram (pg)/mL; dose reduction or discontinuation may be required with iPTH levels below 150 pg/mL
  • Neurologic:
  • -- Seizures have been reported and may be due to hypocalcemia; monitoring recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Cinacalcet: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Hypotension (Chronic kidney disease, 11.6%)
  • Endocrine metabolic:Hypercalcemia (Parathyroid carcinoma, 21%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain (Chronic kidney disease, 10.9%), Constipation (Chronic kidney disease, 5%; parathyroid carcinoma, 10%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 18%), Diarrhea (Chronic kidney disease, 21%), Loss of appetite (Chronic kidney disease, 6%; parathyroid carcinoma, 21%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 6%), Nausea (Chronic kidney disease, 29% to 31%; parathyroid carcinoma, 66%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 30% to 59%), Vomiting (chronic kidney disease, 26% to 27%; parathyroid carcinoma, 52%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 35%)
  • Hematologic:Anemia (parathyroid carcinoma, 17%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 6%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (Parathyroid carcinoma, 17%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 6%), Backache (Primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%), Fracture of bone (Parathyroid carcinoma, 21%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%), Myalgia (Chronic kidney disease, 15%), Spasm (Primary hyperparathyroidism, 18%; chronic kidney disease, 11.1%)
  • Neurologic:Asthenia (Chronic kidney disease, 5.4% to 7%; parathyroid carcinoma, 17%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%), Dizziness (Chronic kidney disease, 7.3% to 10%), Headache (Parathyroid carcinoma, 21%; primary hyperparathyroidism or chronic kidney disease, 12%), Paresthesia (Parathyroid carcinoma, 14%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 29%)
  • Psychiatric:Depression (parathyroid carcinoma, 10%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 18%)
  • Respiratory:Cough (Chronic kidney disease, 11.7%), Dyspnea (Chronic kidney disease, 13.4%), Upper respiratory infection (Parathyroid carcinoma, 10%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%; chronic kidney disease, 7.6%)
  • Other:Dehydration (parathyroid carcinoma, 24%), Fatigue (parathyroid carcinoma, 21%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 12%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Prolonged QT interval, Ventricular arrhythmia
  • Endocrine metabolic:Hypocalcemia (Secondary hyperparathyroidism or chronic kidney disease, 8% to 75%; primary hyperparathyroidism, 6.1%)
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction (Chronic kidney disease, 9.4%)
  • Neurologic:Seizure (0.7% to 2.5%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Cinacalcet hydrochloride enhances the sensitivity of the calcium sensing receptor to extracellular calcium, thus, directly reducing the levels of parathyroid hormone (PTH) and serum calcium levels.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, Oral: 2 to 6 hours
  • Effect of food: Cmax and AUC increased

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Hepatic; extensive
  • Hydrocinnamic acid and hydroxy-hydrocinnamic acid: inactive
  • Glucuronidated dihydrodiols: inactive
  • Inhibitor of CYP2D6
  • Substrate of CYP3A4, CYP2D6, and CYP1A2

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • Take with food or shortly after a meal.
  • Swallow tablets whole; do not divide.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• parathyroid carcinoma or primary hyperparathyroidism: serum calcium levels; within 1 week following initiation of therapy, following any dose adjustment, and then every 2 months thereafter
  • secondary hyperparathyroidism: intact parathyroid hormone levels; within 1 to 4 weeks following initiation of therapy or any dose adjustment
  • secondary hyperparathyroidism: serum calcium levels; within 1 week following initiation of therapy, following any dose adjustment, frequently during dose titration, and monthly once maintenance dose established
  • secondary hyperparathyroidism: serum phosphorus levels; within 1 week following initiation of therapy and following any dose adjustment
  • improvement of clinical symptoms of hyperparathyroidism (eg, bone pain, arthralgias, fatigue, pruritus) is indicative of efficacy
  • radiologic bone studies (eg, bone mineral density); status of progressive bone disease
  • serum calcium levels, especially in patients with a history of seizure disorder or moderate or sever hepatic impairment; during treatment
  • serum phosphorus levels, in patients with moderate or severe hepatic impairment; throughout treatment
  • intact parathyroid hormone levels, in patients with moderate or severe hepatic impairment; throughout treatment
  • signs and symptoms of hypocalcemia including paresthesias, myalgias, muscle cramping, tetany, and convulsions

sub.title: Clinical Effects
sub.mono:
CINACALCET
OVERDOSE: Limited experience. Cinacalcet overdose is anticipated to cause hypocalcemia. Clinical features of hypocalcemia may include: paraesthesias, myalgias, cramping, tetany, seizure activity, QTc prolongation and in severe cases dysrhythmias. ADVERSE EFFECTS: Based on its pharmacodynamic effect, hypocalcemia may be anticipated with therapy. The most frequently reported adverse effects reported with cinacalcet use are nausea (31%) and vomiting (27%). Other symptoms reported with therapeutic use include: headache, paraesthesias, fatigue, diarrhea, anxiety, anorexia, myalgia, dizziness, hypertension, asthenia, and non-cardiac chest pain. Seizure activity was reported in only a small percentage of cinacalcet-treated patients.

sub.title: Treatment
sub.mono:
CINACALCET
  • Support: Treatment is symptomatic and supportive.
  • Decontamination: Consider activated charcoal after a potentially toxic ingestion and if the patient is able to maintain airway or if airway is protected.
  • Hypocalcemia: Hypocalcemia may develop following cinacalcet exposure - ionized fraction determines if patient is symptomatic. Treatment is dependent on laboratory and clinical presentation. Ten milliliters of 10% calcium gluconate or calcium chloride (initial bolus) IV over 10 to 15 minutes. More rapid administration may be necessary in patients with dysrhythmias. Repeat bolus or a maintenance infusion may be necessary.
  • Seizure: IV benzodiazepines, barbiturates.
  • Hypophosphatemia: Monitor serum phosphate levels. Parenteral therapy may be indicated in severe hypophosphatemia (less than 1 milligram/deciliter), but can worsen already existing hypocalcemia.
  • Monitoring of patient: Monitor vital signs frequently; institute continuous ECG monitoring. Monitor serial serum calcium concentration. Nadir in serum calcium level occurs 8 to 12 hours after a single therapeutic dose. Clinical features to monitor for following acute exposure or overdose should include: tingling, paresthesia, tetany, or seizures which can occur if hypocalcemia is present.

sub.title: Range of Toxicity
sub.mono:
CINACALCET
TOXICITY: Range of toxicity is not well defined. Doses up to 300 mg/day (titrated) have been tolerated in hemodialysis patients. THERAPEUTIC DOSE: Recommended starting dose is 30 mg daily for the treatment of secondary hyperparathyroidism or parathyroid carcinoma. In patients with parathyroid carcinoma, doses of cinacalcet can be titrated up to 90 mg 3 to 4 times daily (270 mg to 360 mg daily) as necessary.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
  • Instruct patients to report nausea, vomiting, and signs/symptoms of hypocalcemia (muscle pain or cramps, seizure, or skin tingling or numbness).
  • Patients should take tablets whole with food or shortly after a meal.
